sentences.sContent: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.sCn: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

sentences.sContent: ...If fossil fuel prices remain low for a long time...
...Fossil fuels remain the major source of primary energy consumption in today's world...
...if fossil fuel prices remain low for long...
...a telescope that has observed some 500 million objects—but these remain the exception...
...these jobs would remain undone or be done inefficiently...
...and many elements remain central features of today's kitchen...
...But many people remain unemployed and unemployed workers face difficult odds...
...- allowing her to remain fully immersed in the narrative...
...They remain stuck in the "environment is cost" mentality...

synos.tran: 保持；依然；留下；剩余；逗留；残存

phrases.pCn: 保持冷静，保持镇静；面不改色

words.tran: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人

trans.tranOther: to stay in the same place without moving away

trans.tranCn: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
trans.tranOther: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed
